idea-plugin.name: Enhanced Debug View
idea-plugin.description:
Enhanced debugging experience for Python developers. This plugin extends PyCharm's debugger to show available methods, sorted private and protected fields, all dunder methods and fields for objects during debugging sessions. By default, python's debugger doesn't show any methods that have objects, so the plugging resolve the problem, so you will know that methods available for specific object. Also, python's debugger show non-readable names for private methods like __Classname__privatefield, but in the code you named it like __privatefield, the plugin can combine the fields together and show you it as expected without __classname.
Features: - Context menu action to show methods, sorted private and protected fields, dunder methods and fields for any specific object in debugger - Automatic display of methods for all objects for all debugging sessions(configurable) - Context menu for activation automatic display methods for all objects only for the current debugging session - Toggle between manual and automatic mode - Clean integration with existing debugger UI

action.text: Add extra data to the object
action.description: Show available methods, sorted private and protected fields, dunder methods for this object

action.text: Enable Auto adding extra data for the current session
action.description: Enable automatic methods, sorted private and protected fields, dunder methods attribute addition on object expansion
